verses.kjv: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;
verses.web: Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers who write oppressive decrees;
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who write unjust laws and draft oppressive regulations —

verses.kjv: To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!
verses.web: to deprive the needy from justice, and to rob the poor among my people of their rights, that widows may be their plunder, and that they may make the fatherless their prey!
verses.ct: laws designed to deny justice to the needy and strip the poor among my people of their rights, so that widows become easy prey and orphans get robbed.

verses.kjv: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?
verses.web: What will you do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?
verses.ct: What will you do when the day of punishment arrives, when destruction comes from far away? Who will you run to for help? Where will you hide your wealth?

verses.kjv: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.web: They will only bow down under the prisoners, and will fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: Without me, you'll either crouch among the prisoners or fall among the dead. Yet even after all this, his anger hasn't faded, and his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.
verses.web: Alas Assyrian, the rod of my anger, the staff in whose hand is my indignation!
verses.ct: "What sorrow awaits Assyria — the club I use to express my anger, the stick I wield in my fury!

verses.kjv: I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.web: I will send him against a profane nation, and against the people who anger me I will give him a command to take the plunder and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.ct: I'm sending him against a godless nation. I'm ordering him to march against the people who have provoked my wrath — to plunder them, to loot them, and to trample them like mud in the streets.

verses.kjv: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off nations not a few.
verses.web: However he doesn’t mean so, neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.
verses.ct: But that's not what the Assyrian king has in mind. He doesn't see himself as my instrument. His real goal is to destroy and wipe out nation after nation.

verses.kjv: For he saith, Are not my princes altogether kings?
verses.web: For he says, “Aren’t all of my princes kings?
verses.ct: He boasts, 'Aren't all my commanders as powerful as kings?

verses.kjv: Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?
verses.web: Isn’t Calno like Carchemish? Isn’t Hamath like Arpad? Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?”
verses.ct: Didn't Calno fall just like Carchemish? Wasn't Hamath conquered like Arpad? Wasn't Samaria taken down like Damascus?

verses.kjv: As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
verses.web: As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols, whose engraved images exceeded those of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
verses.ct: My hand has seized kingdoms full of idols — kingdoms whose carved images were greater than those of Jerusalem and Samaria.

verses.kjv: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
verses.web: shall I not, as I have done to Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
verses.ct: Won't I do to Jerusalem and her idols exactly what I did to Samaria and hers?'"

verses.kjv: Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.
verses.web: Therefore it will happen that when the Lord has performed his whole work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the willful proud heart of the king of Assyria, and the insolence of his arrogant looks.
verses.ct: But when the Lord has finished using Assyria to carry out his full plan against Mount Zion and Jerusalem, he will turn and punish the king of Assyria for his arrogant heart and his proud, contemptuous attitude.

verses.kjv: For he saith, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I am prudent: and I have removed the bounds of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man:
verses.web: For he has said, “By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I have understanding. I have removed the boundaries of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures. Like a valiant man I have brought down their rulers.
verses.ct: Because the Assyrian king has said, "I did all this by my own strength and wisdom, because I'm so clever. I've redrawn the borders of nations, plundered their treasures, and brought down their rulers like a mighty warrior.

verses.kjv: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth eggs that are left, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.
verses.web: My hand has found the riches of the peoples like a nest, and like one gathers eggs that are abandoned, I have gathered all the earth. There was no one who moved their wing, or that opened their mouth, or chirped.”
verses.ct: My hand reached into the wealth of nations like reaching into a bird's nest. Like someone gathering abandoned eggs, I gathered the whole earth — and no one flapped a wing, opened a mouth, or made a sound."

verses.kjv: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself, as if it were no wood.
verses.web: Should an ax brag against him who chops with it? Should a saw exalt itself above him who saws with it? As if a rod should lift those who lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up someone who is not wood.
verses.ct: But can an ax brag about being mightier than the one who swings it? Can a saw claim to be greater than the person using it? That would be like a stick swinging the hand that lifts it, or a wooden staff picking up the person who carries it!

verses.kjv: Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord, LORD of Armies, will send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory a burning will be kindled like the burning of fire.
verses.ct: So the Lord, the LORD of Armies, will send a wasting disease among Assyria's strongest warriors. Beneath all their glory, a fire will be kindled that burns and burns.

verses.kjv: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;
verses.web: The light of Israel will be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame; and it will burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day.
verses.ct: The Light of Israel will become a fire, and his Holy One will become a flame. In a single day it will burn up Assyria's thorns and briers.

verses.kjv: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.
verses.web: He will consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body. It will be as when a standard bearer faints.
verses.ct: It will consume the glory of his forests and fertile fields — everything, soul and body — like a sick man wasting away.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.
verses.web: The remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, so that a child could write their number.
verses.ct: So few trees will be left in his forest that a child could count them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.web: It will come to pass in that day that the remnant of Israel, and those who have escaped from the house of Jacob will no more again lean on him who struck them, but shall lean on LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.ct: When that day comes, the survivors of Israel — those who escaped from the house of Jacob — will never again depend on the nation that beat them down. Instead, they will truly rely on the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.
verses.web: A remnant will return, even the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.
verses.ct: A remnant will come back — a remnant of Jacob — to the mighty God.

verses.kjv: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return: the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.
verses.web: For though your people, Israel, are like the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return. A destruction is determined, overflowing with righteousness.
verses.ct: Even though your people Israel are as numerous as the sand of the sea, only a remnant will return. Destruction has been decreed, and it will overflow with righteousness.

verses.kjv: For the Lord GOD of hosts shall make a consumption, even determined, in the midst of all the land.
verses.web: For the Lord, LORD of Armies, will make a full end, and that determined, throughout all the earth.
verses.ct: For the Lord GOD of Armies has determined to bring complete destruction across the whole land.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD of hosts, O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian: he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord, LORD of Armies, says “My people who dwell in Zion, don’t be afraid of the Assyrian, though he strike you with the rod, and lift up his staff against you, as Egypt did.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD of Armies says: "My people who live in Zion, don't be afraid of the Assyrians when they beat you with a rod and raise their staff against you the way Egypt once did.

verses.kjv: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.
verses.web: For yet a very little while, and the indignation against you will be accomplished, and my anger will be directed to his destruction.”
verses.ct: In just a little while, my fury against you will be over, and my anger will turn to destroy them instead."

verses.kjv: And the LORD of hosts shall stir up a scourge for him according to the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb: and as his rod was upon the sea, so shall he lift it up after the manner of Egypt.
verses.web: LORD of Armies will stir up a scourge against him, as in the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb. His rod will be over the sea, and he will lift it up like he did against Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies will raise a whip against Assyria, just as he struck Midian at the rock of Oreb. He will stretch out his rod over the sea and lift it up, just as he did against Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.
verses.web: It will happen in that day that his burden will depart from off your shoulder, and his yoke from off your neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing oil.
verses.ct: When that day comes, the Assyrian burden will be lifted from your shoulders and their yoke removed from your neck. The yoke will be shattered because of the anointing.

verses.kjv: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:
verses.web: He has come to Aiath. He has passed through Migron. At Michmash he stores his baggage.
verses.ct: The invader has arrived at Aiath! He has marched through Migron! He has stored his supplies at Michmash!

verses.kjv: They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
verses.web: They have gone over the pass. They have taken up their lodging at Geba. Ramah trembles. Gibeah of Saul has fled.
verses.ct: They've crossed through the pass and camped at Geba for the night. Ramah is trembling. Gibeah of Saul has fled in panic.

verses.kjv: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.
verses.web: Cry aloud with your voice, daughter of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! You poor Anathoth!
verses.ct: Scream out loud, people of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! Poor Anathoth!

verses.kjv: Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.
verses.web: Madmenah is a fugitive. The inhabitants of Gebim flee for safety.
verses.ct: Madmenah's people are running. The residents of Gebim are scrambling to escape.

verses.kjv: As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
verses.web: This very day he will halt at Nob. He shakes his hand at the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Today he will stop at Nob. From there he shakes his fist at the mountain of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, shall lop the bough with terror: and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.
verses.web: Behold, the Lord, LORD of Armies, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low.
verses.ct: But look — the Lord, the LORD of Armies, will hack off the branches with terrifying power. The tallest trees will be chopped down, and the loftiest will be brought low.

verses.kjv: And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
verses.web: He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.
verses.ct: He will cut through the dense forest with an iron ax, and Lebanon's mighty trees will fall before the Mighty One.
